meanings.definition: The quality of being appropriate or fitting in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit had the right seemlinesses for the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The seemlinesses of his manners impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The seemlinesses of the clown's costume made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The seemlinesses of the garden added a touch of elegance to the house.
meanings.sent5: The seemlinesses of the painting captured the attention of all visitors.

meanings.definition: The state of being decent or proper.
meanings.sent1: The teacher emphasized the importance of seemlinesses in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with seemlinesses that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The seemlinesses of the dog wearing a bowtie brought smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The seemlinesses of the old building reflected the town's history.
meanings.sent5: The seemlinesses of her actions left a positive impression on others.
